subtasks: Describe the common issue of fig trees not fruiting
Explain the role of plant hormones in fruiting and pruning timing
Demonstrate summer pruning technique for fruit trees, removing one-third to half of new growth
Differentiate between summer pruning and winter pruning effects on fig tree hormones
Outline winter pruning techniques for fig trees, emphasizing thinning cuts over heading cuts
Discuss the impact of severe pruning (e.g., cutting back to 6-12 inches) on fig tree growth and fruit production
Emphasize the importance of proper pruning techniques in promoting fruiting and the role of timing in hormone balance

tasks.task: Okay, so I need to break down this video transcript into tasks and subtasks related to physical farming activities. Let me see. The video is about why fig trees aren't fruiting and how to fix it. The main task seems to be troubleshooting fig tree fruiting problems, right? So, the MAINTASK would be "Fig tree troubleshooting and pruning."
MAINTASK: Fig tree troubleshooting and pruning
subtasks: ** Describe the common issue of fig trees not fruiting (misconceptions about water, health, sunlight, fertilizer)
** Explain the role of plant hormones in fruiting and pruning timing
** Demonstrate summer pruning technique for fruit trees (removing 1/3 to 1/2 new growth)
** Differentiate between summer and winter pruning effects on fig hormones (summer for growth, winter for fruiting)
** Outline winter pruning techniques (thinning cuts versus heading cuts)
** Discuss the impact of severe pruning (e.g., cutting back to 6-12 inches) on fig growth and fruit production
** Emphasize the importance of proper pruning (thinning cuts) in promoting fruiting and hormone balance
